member.name: T:Rainbow.Administration
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
This object can be used only by user with administration right
It permits to manage Companies and Users members.
It can also be used to create Guest users who are specific temporaly users that can be used in Rainbow.

member.summary:
To create a in the company directory or the personal directory.
If "CompanyId" is not specified, the entry is added in the personal directory of the logged user.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Alerts
member.summary:
Alerts (notifications) service.
There are notions of: - AlertDevice: targets of alerts (can be of only on Company) - AlertFilter: to filter devices - AlertTemplate: to define the content of an alert using CAP structure (Common Alert Protocol)

member.name: E:Rainbow.Alerts.AlertMessageReceived
member.summary:
The event raised when the current user received an alert message
The object permits to know the alert message

member.name: M:Rainbow.Alerts.CreateDevice(Rainbow.Model.AlertDevice,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.AlertDevice}})
member.summary:
Create a device which can receive Alerts(notifications) from the server
AlertDevice.Jid_im cannot be specified, it's always the Jid of the current user: Contacts.GetCurrentContactJid()
if AlertDevice.Jid_resource cannot be specified, it's always the Jid_resource of the current user: Application.GetResourceId()
if AlertDevice.Type is not specified, automatically it's set to "desktop"
member.param: AlertDevice to create. If AlertDevice.Ji
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

AlertDevice.Jid_im cannot be specified, it's always the Jid of the current user: Contacts.GetCurrentContactJid()
AlertDevice.Jid_resource cannot be specified, it's always the Jid_resource of the current user: Application.GetResourceId()
if AlertDevice.Type is not specified, automatically it's set to "desktop"
member.param: AlertDevice to create. If AlertDevice.Ji

member.name: M:Rainbow.Alerts.GetDevices(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.AlertDevicesData}})
member.summary: Get list of devices
member.param: Allows to filter device list on the companyId provided in this option. (optional) If companyId is not provided, the devices linked to all the companies that the administrator manage are returned.

Allows to filter device list on the userId provided in this option. (optional) If the user has no admin rights, this filter is forced to the logged in user's id (i.e. the user can only list is own devices).

Allows to filter device list on the name provided in this option. (optional) The filtering is case insensitive and on partial name match: all devices containing the provided name value will be returned(whatever the position of the match). Ex: if filtering is done on My, devices with the following names are match the filter 'My device', 'My phone', 'This is my device', ...
Allows to filter device list on the type provided in this option. (optional, exact match, case sensitive)
Allows to filter device list on the tag provided in this option. (optional, exact match, case sensitive)
Allow to specify the position of first device to retrieve (first device if not specified). Warning: if offset > total, no results are returned.
Allow to specify the number of devices to retrieve.
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.summary:
Main object of the SDK.
It permits to connect/disconnect from the Rainbow server and manage current contact password.
It's also the only way to get objects to manage , , , , , , , , , , , , , and .

Event raised when the server connection is updated
The object permits to know the connection state
The server can asked to stop the connection. Fields and permits to have more information when this case occur.

member.name: M:Rainbow.Application.LoginWithToken(System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
To log on the server using the specified token. The token is then renew. The Event pipe is automatically created / used.
If this method failed, it's necessary to login again using a valid login / password or SSO method
This token is saved in cache when a previous login has been performed successfully - see method
Once the log on operation is done successfully, it means that the token is valid and correct. But it's still necessary to wait event before to ask anything to the server
member.param: The token to use
Callback fired when the operation is done - object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.Application.LoginWithToken(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
To log on the server using the specified token. The token is then renew. The Event pipe is automatically created / used only if "autoLoginToEventPipe" is set to true
If this method failed, it's necessary to login again using a valid login / password or SSO method
This token is saved in cache when a previous login has been performed successfully - see method
Once the log on operation is done successfully, it means that the token is valid and correct. But it's still necessary to wait event before to ask anything to the server
member.param: The token to use
To know if the event pipe connection must be done automatically once the user is logged
Callback fired when the operation is done - object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.Application.LoginWithTokenWithoutEventPipe(System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
To log on the server using the specified token in advanced scenario only since the connection to the event pipe is not performed automatically but must be done manually.
The token is renew on success. If this method failed, it's necessary to login again using a valid login / password
The token is saved in cache when a previous login has been performed successfully - see method
Once the log on operation is done successfully, it means that the token is valid and correct. But it's still necessary to use method to connect to the event pipe and then wait event before to ask anything to the server since the connection to the event pipe is not performed yet.
It's possible to use this method only if is used.
member.param: The token to use
Callback fired when the operation is done - object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

But it's still necessary to wait event before to ask anything to the server since the connection to the event pipe is not performed yet.
member.param: The login of the user
The password of the user - Should be greater or equal to 12 characters
Callback fired when the operation is done - object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

It's necessary to use method to connect to the event pipe and then wait event before to ask anything to the server since the connection to the event pipe is not performed yet.
It's possible to use this method only if is used.
member.param: The login of the user
The password of the user - Should be greater or equal to 12 characters

member.name: M:Rainbow.Application.AskResetCodeToChangePassword(System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
If the contact doesn't remember it's password, ask to received a code by email to change it
Language format is composed of locale using format ISO 639-1, with optionally the regional variation using ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (separated by hyphen). Locale part is in lowercase, regional part is in uppercase.
Examples: en, en-US, fr, fr-FR, fr-CA, es-ES, es-MX, ...
Default value:'en-US'.
More information about the format can be found on this link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language_localisation#Language_tags_and_codes
member.param: The language ID to use to format email
Callback fired when the operation is done - object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: T:Rainbow.AutoReconnection
member.summary:
This service try to automatically reconnect to the server in case of disconnection.
This service is enabled only if **AutoReconnection** property in is set to True.
This service (if enabled) is started only after a first successful authentication (see event).
This service is stopped / cancelled: - if method is used - if the current user uses method - if the maximum number of attempts is reached. - if the user token has expired and is set to False. - if an attempt (using token or user credentails) is not accepted by the server: inappropriate token or if this user has no more the right to access to the server (account disabled or deleted for example)
When Stopped / Cancelled, the event is raised.
An attempt is performed by this service only if at least one network interface is up (enabled and with an ip address).
Once connected again, the number of attempt is set to zero.
If the maximum number of attempt is reached, the event is also raised.
Each attempt uses the user token to connect to the server if it's not expired. This service (if enabled) ensure to renew the current token on its half-life.
If it's no more possible to renew it, the event is raised and the connection to the server is automatically stopped.
In this case, if is set to False the service is also stopped. If it's set to True, the service try to use previous credentials to connect to the server.
Default values: - = 50 - = { 200, 200, 400, 800, 1600, 2000, 2000, ... } (not necessary to specify all values, last one is used for all others attempts - = { "virtual" };

member.name: E:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.MaxNbAttemptsReached
member.summary:
Event raised once the maximum number of attempts is reached. This service is stopped too so the event is also raised.
It's up to the application using the SDK to continue its own process.
This service will be started again after a successful authentication (see event).

member.name: E:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.Cancelled
member.summary:
Event raised when the service is stopped / cancelled - if method is used (=> Value set as "Cancelled") - if the current user uses method (=> Value set as "Logout") - if the maximum number of attempts is reached. (=> Value set as "MaxNbAttemptsReached") - if the user token has expired and is set to False. (=> Value set as "TokenExpired") - if an attempt (using token or user credentails) is not accepted by the server: inappropriate token or if this user has no more the right to access to the server (account disabled or deleted for example) (=> Value set as "InvalidCredentials") - if the server asked to stop the connection (=> Value set as "DisconnectedByServer")
To know the Value of the cancellation check
Ir the server asked to stop the connection, you can have more information using

member.name: E:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.OneNetworkInterfaceOperational
member.summary:
Event raised when one network interface is up (enabled and with an IP Address) or not.
The boolean value in the event can permit to know if at least one interface is up (true) or not (false).
In some cases, this event can be raised some seconds before event when there is no more network interface available.

member.name: E:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.TokenExpired
member.summary:
Event raised when the token cannot be renew anymore. The connection to the server is also automatically stopped.
If is set to False, the service is stopped.
If set to True, the service try to connect to the server using previous credentials.

member.name: E:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.Started
member.summary: Event raised when this service is started(must be enabled first): only after a first successful authentication (see event).

member.name: P:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.IsStarted
member.summary: To know if the service is started

member.name: P:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.UsePreviousLoginPwd
member.summary:
To know if the previous login/pwd must be used if the token can no more be used in the login process
Default value: True

member.name: P:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.MaxNbAttempts
member.summary:
Maximum number of attempts performed by this service to reconnect to the server.
Default value: 50

member.name: P:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.DelayBetweenAttempts
member.summary:
Delay in milliseconds to use beetween each attempt. A new attempt is performed ONLY when at least one network interface is operational.
Default values: { 200, 200, 400, 800, 1600, 2000, 2000, ... } (not necessary to specify all values, last one is used for all others attempts.

member.name: P:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.CurrentNbAttempts
member.summary: To know the current attempts number. It's automatically resetted once the connections is well performed.

member.name: M:Rainbow.AutoReconnection.LoginUsingPreviousCredentials
member.summary: Try to log on the server using previous credentials - If still valid, uses the user token stored in INI file (encrypted) - If attempt with token failed (i.e not accepted by the server, token is not valid), and if **UsePreviousLoginPwd** property is set to true, uses Login/Pwd stored in INI file (encrypted) - If the use of Login/Pwd event failed too, event is raised.
member.returns: - True is previous Token is valid or if Previous Login/Pwd are not empty. In this case, event is used to know if the login process cannot be performed.

This object is available only using from object.
Bubbles class is used to get / set / update info about any .
A Bubble permit to send / receive instant messaging with a specific group of persons
A cache is used to maintain the list of availalbe bubbles for the connected contact
To know if a bubble has been created or removed its necessary to use events and in object
NOTE: The cache only store Bubble information but no avatars - It's up to user's SDK to manage / store Avatars of each bubble.

member.summary: To create a new Bubble
member.param: Name of the bubble (max 255)
Topic of the bubble (max 255)
Visibility of the bubble - See for possible values
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
Previous messages history to provide to new contact in the room - possible values: none, all, number
Related to parameter **history** - the number of previous messages to provide to new contact in the room
When set to true, there is no more notifications to be sent by a room in all cases with text body (contact join/leave, conference start/end)
Defines at creation the room will host a conference. - See for possible values

A contact can create a room and not have to register contacts. He can share instead a public link also called 'public URL'(contacts public link).
According with autoRegister value, if another person uses the link to join the room:
autoRegister = 'unlock': If this contact is not yet registered inside this room, he is automatically included with the status 'accepted' and join the room.
autoRegister = 'lock': If this contact is not yet registered inside this room, he can't access to the room. So that he can't join the room

member.name: T:Rainbow.Channels
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
Channels class is used to get / set / update info about any .
Channel can be used when you want to notify a large group of users without having to send a chat message individually to each.
You can create and administrate 3 differents types of channels accessible only by users in your company
**Public Channel**:
Users are free to subscribe to a public channel. Public channels can be found when searching for channels. The visibility of a channel is limited to your company.
**Private Channel**:
Only Owner can add or remove users in a private channels. Private channels CAN NOT be found when searching for channels. Consequently, users CAN subscribe / unsubscribe on their own to private channel.
**Closed Channel**:
Only Owner can add or remove users in a private channels. Private channels CAN NOT be found when searching for channels. Consequently, users CAN NOT subscribe / unsubscribe on their own to closed channel.
In a channel, the membership of a user (role) can be owner, member, publisher or none.
**Owner**:
The owner is the user who creates the channel. A owner can modify information of the channel, can invite other users (including new owners) can publish messages and can receive incoming messages.
**Publisher**:
A publisher is a member of a channel who can publish messages in that channel and can receive incoming messages.
**Member**:
A member of a channel can only receive incoming messages.
**None**:
A user with this particular role is a user who left the channel (by his own or removed by a owner).

member.name: T:Rainbow.Conferences
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
Conferences class is used to get / set / update info about any .
A cache is used to maintain the list of availalbe Conferences for the connected contact.
Notice that today ONLY ONE conference in progress is allowed (server restriction). The SDK is already designed to manage several in same time.
Methods to use are the same but internally the way to exchange with the server is different.
Version 2 must be used if all clients are using it (Web, Desktop, etc ...). At term only the version 2 will be used (It will not be possible to use version 1)

member.name: T:Rainbow.Contacts
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
Contacts is used to get / set / update info about any .
A cache is used internally and updated automatically when a contact is added, updated, removed
NOTE: The cache only store contact information but no avatars - It's up to user's SDK to manage / store Avatars of each contact.

The object permits to know which avatar's peer has been updated

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.PeerAvatarDeleted
member.summary:
The event raised when an avatar's peer has been deleted on server side.
The object permits to know which avatar's peer has been updated

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.PeerInfoChanged
member.summary:
The event raised when a Peer information has been updated on server side (and not when its presence level changed).
The object permits to know which Peer has been updated

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.PeerAdded
member.summary:
The event raised when a Peer has been added in the cache.
The object permits to know which Peer has been added

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.RosterPeerAdded
member.summary:
The event raised when a Peer has been added in your roster. The associated Contact is automatically added in the cache.
The PeerAdded event is also raised.
The object permits to know which Peer has been added using

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.RosterPeerRemoved
member.summary:
The event raised when a Peer has been removed from your roster. The associated contact is not removed from the cache.
The object permits to know which Peer has been removed

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.ContactPresenceChanged
member.summary:
The event raised when a presence has changed from a contact for one of its resource/device (and not when its info has been changed). This event is usefull only if you want specifically know the contacts presence for each resource/device. If it's not the case use instead event.
You never received this event for a contact in the cache but not in your roster
The object permits to know which contact and for which resource is concerned using it's Jid Im and it's new presence - See

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.ContactAggregatedPresenceChanged
member.summary:
The event raised when the aggregated presence has changed from a contact in your roster only (and not when its info has been changed)
You never received this event for a contact in the cache but not in your roster
Aggregated presence is a summarize of all presences from all resource of the specified contact. So ContactPresenceChnaged can be raised several time but perhaps not ContactAggregatedPresenceChanged
The object permits to know which contact is concerned using it's Jid Im and it's new presence - See

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.SynchroProviderStatusChanged
member.summary:
Event raised when synchronization status with a provider has changed.
For example, when calendar synchronization with "office365" or "google" has been enabled / disabled or when presence synchronization with "teams" has been enabled / disabled.
Even after the SDK has been initialized, no synchronization status is available.
It's necessary to use:
- to get the presence synchronization status with Teams
- to get the calendar synchronization status with "office365" or "google"
Once connected, even if no synchronization status has been asked, this event will be raised if synchronization status with a provider has changed.

member.name: E:Rainbow.Contacts.UserSettingsChanged
member.summary: Event raised when at least one user settings has changed.

member.name: M:Rainbow.Contacts.SearchContactsByTag(System.String,System.Int32,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.SearchContactsResult}},System.String)
member.summary:
To search contacts by 'tag'. This search is using several fields: firstName, lastName, jobTitle, companyName and tags.
The result comes from only source: * Rainbow public users and users being in companies visible by logged in user's company.
It's possible to set the maximum number of results
member.param: A string used to perform the search (with at least two caracters)
The maximum number of results expected (no more than 20)
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
The ID company to restrict the search or an empty value

member.name: M:Rainbow.Contacts.SearchContactsByDisplayName(System.String,System.Int32,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.SearchContactsResult}},System.String)
member.summary:
To search contacts by their names.
The result comes from 3 distinct sources: * Rainbow public users and users being in companies visible by logged in user's company. * Phonebook of the user's company (if users has the permission) - * Office 365 Active Directory of the user's company (if users has the permission) * Directory of the user's company (if users has the permission)
It's possible to set the maximum number (cannot be greater than 20) of results but it's for each source
The search is done by: [first name], [last name], [first and last name] and [last and first name]
member.param: A string used to perform the search (with at least two caracters)
The maximum number of results expected (no more than 20) on each source
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
The ID company to restrict the search or an empty value

member.name: M:Rainbow.Contacts.SearchContactByPhoneNumber(System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.SearchContactsResult}},System.String)
member.summary:
To search contacts by phone number
The result comes from 4 distinct sources: * Rainbow public users and users being in companies visible by logged in user's company. The API search for users having the provided E164 number filled in their profile * Phonebook of the user's company (if users has the permission) - * Office 365 Active Directory of the user's company (if users has the permission) * Directory of the user's company (if users has the permission)
Whatever the source an exact match is expected to have a result
member.param: A string used to perform the search (with at least 3 caracters)
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
The ID company to restrict the search or an empty value

To search contacts by emails list
The result comes from only one source * Rainbow public users and users being in companies visible by logged in user's company.
The maximum number of loginEmails allowed to be provided is 1000. No contact is returned if it's the case
member.param: A list of email to find
Callback fired when the operation is done - is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.summary: - Criticity of the status (if any) - info usefull only if a is not null/empty 'fatal': we are disconnected and the AutoReconnection service (if used) will stop immediatly. 'info': we are not disconnected but the server returns an error

member.name: T:Rainbow.Favorites
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
Favorites is used to get / set / update info about any favorite which concern the current contact with a a Peer Id (Contact or Bubble)
When an Favorite is created / updated / deleted an event is fired
A cache is used to have always a valid lis of favorites in the correct order

member.name: T:Rainbow.FileStorage
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
This services permits to manage files shared in Rainbow * Upload and download files * Get the list of files shared (sent or received) in a conversation (one to one or in a bubble) * Remove files
A object is used to know details of a file shared with someone.
A cache is used to maintain the list of files descriptor accessible by the current user

member.name: E:Rainbow.FileStorage.RecordingFileUpdated
member.summary: Event fired when a recording is performed and when files associated are avaialble / in progress

member.name: E:Rainbow.FileStorage.FileStorageUpdated
member.summary:
Event fired when a file has been added / deleted / updated in the file storage of the current user
Voice messages stored in voice mail are not concerned by this event - see event instead
The object permits to know the file id and the action done on it

member.name: E:Rainbow.FileStorage.VoiceMessageUpdated
member.summary:
Event fired when a voice message has been added / deleted / updated in the file storage of the current user
The object permits to know the voice message Id, the file id associated and the action done on it

member.name: E:Rainbow.FileStorage.FileUploadUpdated
member.summary:
Event fired when a file is being uploaded for progress
The object permits to know size already uploade and if the upload is completed or still in progress

member.name: E:Rainbow.FileStorage.FileDownloadUpdated
member.summary:
Event fired when a file is being downloaded and its download progress has been modified.
The object permits to know size already downloaded and if the upload is completed or still in progress

member.name: M:Rainbow.FileStorage.UploadFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String,Rainbow.Model.FileDescriptor,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
Permits to upload a file to the specified PeerId/PeerType using a Stream and a FileDescriptor
It's possible to not specify a PeerId/PeeType to upload file for storage only (shared with nobody)
To share a file with a Peer, it's better to send him a IM Message with the file - see **SendMessageWithFileToConversation** in object.
It's possible to know the upload status of this file using event **FileUploadUpdated**.
The callback **callbackMessage** permits to know if finally the file upload has been uploaded with success.
member.param: a Stream to the file
The PeerID to share this file: a userId or a BubbleId
The type of PeerId - see for possible values
File descriptor object
Callback fired when the file is uploaded - True is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.FileStorage.UploadFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,Rainbow.Model.FileDescriptor,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
Permits to upload a file to the specified PeerId/PeerType using a file path and a file descriptor
It's possible to not specify a PeerId/PeeType to upload file for storage only (shared with nobody)
To share a file with a Peer, it's better to send him a IM Message with the file - see **SendMessageWithFileToConversation** in object.
It's possible to know the upload status of this file using event **FileUploadUpdated**.
The callback **callbackMessage** permits to know if finally the file upload has been uploaded with success.
member.param: File path
The PeerID to share this file: a userId or a BubbleId
The type of PeerId - see for possible values
File descriptor object
Callback fired when the file is uploaded - True is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.FileStorage.UploadFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.FileDescriptor}},System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
Permits to upload a file to the specified PeerId/PeerType using a Stream
It's possible to not specify a PeerId/PeeType to upload file for storage only (shared with nobody)
To share a file with a Peer, it's better to send him a IM Message with the file - see **SendMessageWithFileToConversation** in object.
The callback **callbackFileDescriptor** permits to know the file descriptor created. So it's possible to know the upload status of this file using event **FileUploadUpdated**. If the FileDescriptor is not well created, the file is not uploaded.
The callback **callbackMessage** permits to know if finally the file upload has been uploaded with success.
member.param: Stream used to get file contant.The stream must be readabled and seekable
File name
The PeerID to share this file: a userId or a BubbleId
The type of PeerId - see for possible values
Callback fired when the file descriptor creation is performed - FileDescriptor object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
Callback fired when the file is uploaded - True is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.FileStorage.UploadFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{Rainbow.Model.FileDescriptor}},System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
Permits to upload a file to the specified PeerId/PeerType using a file path.
It's possible to not specify a PeerId/PeeType to upload file for storage only (shared with nobody)
To share a file with a Peer, it's better to send him a IM Message with the file - see **SendMessageWithFileToConversation** in object.
The callback **callbackFileDescriptor** permits to know the file descriptor created. So it's possible to know the upload status of this file using event **FileUploadUpdated**. If the FileDescriptor is not well created, the file is not uploaded and the message is not sent
The callback **callbackMessage** permits to know if finally the file upload has been uploaded with success.
member.param: File path to upload. The file must be accessible and can be opened
The PeerID to share this file: a userId or a BubbleId
The type of PeerId - see for possible values
Callback fired when the file descriptor creation is performed - FileDescriptor object is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs
Callback fired when the file descriptor creation is performed - True is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.summary:
Download file in the specified destination path (a full path with a file name).
A file descriptor with this file Id must in the cache to well start the download.
This method avoid memory buffering and write data directly in a file.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Groups
member.summary:
This service makes it possible to centralize several users by groups. It is up to the end user to create their own groups themselves.
You can create, delete and update groups information but also their members.
An internal cache is used to store information when new data is obtained from server.

member.name: E:Rainbow.Groups.GroupInfoUpdated

member.name: T:Rainbow.IniFileParser
member.summary:
Allow to read / write data using INI structure - it's possibl to use this object based on a File () or based on a text ()
It's possible to use encryption for sensible values.
The SDK internally uses already this class to store Login, Password (in encrypted format) and Token (in encrypted format) To use same INI file that the SDK, use from object.

member.name: T:Rainbow.InstantMessaging
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
This class is mainly used to manage IM messages: - To get / send to contacts or bubbles (with or without a file) - To reply to a - To edit / delete a - To mark a as read - To indicate that the current contact is typing (or not) in a conversation - To get an historic of sent / received in a conversation.
A cache is used internally to store all IM messages sent / received.
It's also possible to send / answer to . This kind of message can only be send to a specific resource (or device) of a Peer. (IM Message are sent to ALL resources of a Peer.)
There is no store / history for . A answer is expected by the sender of if the receiver can manage it.
are not interpreted / managed by standard Rainbow client (Desktop, Web, iOS, Android - i.e. UCaaS Rainbow client)

member.name: E:Rainbow.InstantMessaging.UserTypingChanged
member.summary:
Event raised when a user is typing or finished to type in a conversation
The object permits to know the user Jid, the conversation Id and if user is typing or not.

member.summary: Event raised when the current user received an AdHocCommand

member.summary:
Event raised when the current user received a message from a conversation
The object permits to know the user Jid, the conversation Id and if user is typing or not.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: E:Rainbow.InstantMessaging.MessagesAllDeleted
member.summary:
Event fired when all messages in a conversation have been deleted - can only occur in one to one conversation (not in a bubble)
Before this event is fired, related messages in cache are deleted.
The object permits to know the id of the conversation

member.summary:
To send an to a specific user resource (i.e. a specific device used by a user and not all of these devices) using XML content.
A delay (in ms) can be specified or not. After this delay, if no answer has been received the callback is called with an error.
If no delay is used (-1 is set - default value) and if the Peer doesn't answer to the AdHocCommand, the callback will be never called.
member.param: Message Type (get or set)
Jid of the Peer - cannot be null
Resource of the Peer - cannot be null
Node describing the AdHocCommand - cannot be null
Session describing the AdHocCommand - can be null
Dictionnary of attributes to describe the AdHocCommand - can be null
Content in XML - can be null

Callback fired when an answer to AdHocCommand is received or if the operation cannot be performed (invalid argument for example) - is expected (it's the answer to the AdHocCommand send to the tPeer) in **Data** member of if no error occurs.
Delay (in ms) before to use the callback with an error if the Peed didn't answered yet. -1 by default (i.e. infinite delay)

member.name: M:Rainbow.InstantMessaging.CanSendMessageWithHighUrgencyToConversation(System.String)
member.summary:
To know if it's possible to send a message in a conversation in High Urgency mode.
In One to one conversation it's possible if the peer has a licence.
In a bubble, it's possible if one of the peer has a licence.
member.param: Id of the conversation
member.returns: - True if it's possible

member.returns: - True if it's possible

member.summary:
Send a message with a file to the specified conversation
The callback **callbackFileDescriptor** permits to know the file descriptor created. So it's possible to know the upload status of this file using event **FileUploadUpdated** from . If the FileDescriptor is not well created, the file is not uploaded and the message is not sent
The callback **callbackMessage** permits to know if finally the message with the file associated has been successfully sent.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Invitations
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
Invitations is used to get / set / update info about any which concern the current contact.
To add a person in its roster it's necessary to send him first a invitation.
An invitation can be sent to a **contact already in Rainbow** (found after performed a search for example). In this case, the invitation can be sent using it's **contact ID**.
An invitation can be sent also to a **contact not already in Rainbow** using it's **email address** or it's **phone number**. In this case, an email or a SMS, in the specified language, is sent to this person by the Rainbow server.
When an invitation is send to **a contact from the same company**, the invitation is **'auto-accepted'** - the contact is added in the roster without he needs to accept it.
When an invitation is send to **a contact not from the same company**, **he must accept it** first to have it in its roster.
It's not possible to know if the invitation is specifically declined - it's seen as 'pending' in this case.

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationReceived
member.summary:
The event raised when an invitation has been received - it occurs only when it's send by a contact which is not in the same company.
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationSent
member.summary:
The event raised when an invitation has been sent by the current contact
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationReSent
member.summary:
The event raised when an invitation has been re-sent by the current contact
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationAccepted
member.summary:
The event raised when an invitation has been accepted by the current contact or by another contact
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationDeleted
member.summary:
The event raised when an invitation previously accepted is deleted
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationCancelled
member.summary:
The event raised when an **pending** invitation sent by the current contact has been cancelled by himself
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: E:Rainbow.Invitations.InvitationDeclined
member.summary:
The event raised when an **pending** invitation sent by another contact is declined by the current contact
The object permits to know the id of the invitation received

member.name: T:Rainbow.LogFactory
member.summary:
Class used to manage LoggerFactory object.
It permits to use any back-ends log provider based on Microsoft Extension Logging (MEL):
Sentry provider for the Sentry service
Serilog provider for the Serilog library
elmah.io provider for the elmah.io service
Loggr provider for the Loggr service
NLog provider for the NLog service
Graylog provider for the Graylog service
Sharpbrake provider for the Sharpbrake service
KissLog.net provider for the KissLog.net service

member.summary: Instance of this static class

To create / get logger used to log specfic details about WebRTC.
It's the same than using **LogFactory.CreateLogger("WEBRTC")**
member.returns: - ILogger interface

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.ACDStatus
member.summary: Dsecribe ACD Status

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ACDStatus.State
member.summary: The current state of the agent, can be one of the following : "Ready", "Null", "Null Preassigned" "Work After Call", "Not Ready", "Busy" or "Unknown".

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ACDStatus.AgentId
member.summary: The ACD agent id, if it is not present, the device is not a ACD device.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ACDStatus.CurrentGroupId
member.summary: The last group id the device has been logged in. The client can choose to present it to the user or not, for a Logon action. But when it is not present in the Logon command, the PCG will then use the one it has in memory. Note that the client can also make a Login with a group id being present but empty in the case the ACD agent is only in one group, and then the group id is optional in the Pbx command.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ACDStatus.PasswordPresence
member.summary: If true, the PCG keeps internaly the password and can use it for each CCD action requiring it. So the client does not need to give it in the ACD Logoff or Wrapup command. But if the boolean is false, the client has to give it at the Logon, Logoff or Wrapup action (depending of the ACD state), and then the PCG will keep it in memory. At the start of the PCG, this flag is set to false (independing of the ACD state).

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage
member.summary:
Define an AckMessage
Standard IM message are send to a user (i.e. to all of this devices / resources)
An AckMEssage can be sent to only one resource / device of a user. There is no cache and no history for this messages.
An answer is expected by the sender if the receiver can manage it.
This kind of message are not interpreted / managed by standard Rainbow client (Desktop, Web, iOS, Android)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.Id
member.summary: Id of the message

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.Type
member.summary: Message Type

member.summary: Jid of the receiver - cannot be null

member.summary: Resource of the receiver - cannot be null

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.FromJid
member.summary: Jid of the sender - cannot be null

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.FromResource
member.summary: Resource of the sender - cannot be null

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.Action
member.summary: To describe the purpose of the message

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.MimeType
member.summary: To know the mime type of the message content

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.Content
member.summary:
The message content (as string)
This property is checked before XmlContent property: if this is null/empty, XmlContent is used.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.AckMessage.XmlContent
member.summary:
The message content (as Xml)
Checked / Used only if Content property is null.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.AdHocCommand
member.summary:
Define an AdHocCommand
Standard IM message are send to a user (i.e. to all of this devices / resources)
An AckMEssage can be sent to only one resource / device of a user. There is no cache and no history for this messages.
An answer is expected by the sender if the receiver can manage it.
This kind of message could be not interpreted / managed by standard Rainbow client (Desktop, Web, iOS, Android). For example, in a conference, to ask to start a sharing stream if one is already present.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Alert
member.summary:
Define an Alert object.
It's mandatory to specify a TemplateId
CompanyId is optional. If it's not specified, the companyId of the current user is used.
FilterId is optional. In this case, all devices in the specified company will be alerted.

Describe an alert using CAP (Common Alert Protocol)
In Description, it's possible to use more than "text/plain" format, HTML can be used.
In this case the MimeType must be set to "text/html" AND the Descrition, the HTML code must be encapsulalted in "< ... >"

member.summary: - Application activity domain.

member.summary: - Environment where the application is deploy.(not_deployed, in_deployment, deployed)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.SsoAuthenticationRedirectUrl
member.summary: - URL which can be used by the application as callback URL for authentication using Single Sign On (OIDC, SAML). If this setting is not set, by default the SSO authentication methods redirect the obtained JWT on the URL https://web.openrainbow.com/#/?tkn=

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.OauthRedirectUrisoptionnel
member.summary: - URI(s) used by the application as callback URL for OAuth 2.0. Mandatory parameter to use OAuth 2.0 login method.To ensure the authentication security, Rainbow only sends OAuth authentication tokens to URLs that are set in oauthRedirectUris.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.EnableOAuthImplicitGrant
member.summary: - If set to true, allow the application to use OAuth 2.0 implicit grant. This setting is disabled by default, as implicit flow is less secure than authorize code grant.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.EnableOAuthRefreshTokenRotationoptionnel
member.summary: - If set to true, enable the refresh_token rotation for this application. When refresh_token rotation is enabled, each time the application uses a refresh_token to retrieve a new access_token, a new refresh_token is also returned and the previous refresh_token is revoked. refresh_token rotation reduces the threat if the refresh_token would be compromised, as it will be revoked the next time the application refreshed its access_token. This setting is enabled by default, as refresh_token rotation is more secure. It is not recommended to disabled this setting.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.TermsOfServiceUrloptionnel
member.summary: - URL of the application's website explaining the application's terms of services for the end user. This URL will be displayed as a link in the OAuth 2.0 consent form presented to the user(the page allowing the user to allow the application to access his data). This parameter is optional, if not provided no link will be displayed in the consent form.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.PrivacyPoliciesUrloptionnel
member.summary: - URL of the application's website explaining the application's privacy policy for the end user. This URL will be displayed as a link in the OAuth 2.0 consent form presented to the user(the page allowing the user to allow the application to access his data). This parameter is optional, if not provided no link will be displayed in the consent form.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.AppSuperadminCommentoptionnel
member.summary: - Comment regarding the application (free data). Only returned to users with superadmin/support/app_superadmin/app_support roles.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ApplicationInfo.AppSuperadminStatusoptionnel
member.summary: - Application status (free data). Only returned to users with superadmin/support/app_superadmin/app_support roles.

It's necessary to renew when "ValidTo" is no more accurate.

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Bubble
member.summary:
This class represents a bubble
A bubble is an interaction between several participants based on IM media.A bubble is described by a name and a description.
Like for P2P conversation, A conversation within a bubble never ends and all interactions done can be retrieved.
The contacts list is limited to the first one hundred. A specific call is necessary to retrieve all other members

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Call
member.summary:
This class represents a call.
A call is a "short" interaction between the user and one or several contacts(Rainbow users or not) that uses either a WebRTC media(audio, video or screen sharing) or a Telephony media(PBX phone).
No Rainbow users such as external users can only be engaged into a Telephony call.
A call is always attached to a conversation.

member.summary: List Channel's modes supported

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Channel.ChannelMode.COMPANY_PUBLIC
member.summary: - Users are free to subscribe to a public channel. Public channels can be found when searching for channels. The visibility of a channel is limited to my company.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Channel.ChannelMode.COMPANY_PRIVATE
member.summary: - Private channels can't be found when searching for channels. Consequently, users can't subscribe on their own to private channel but they can unsubscribe to it.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Channel.ChannelMode.COMPANY_CLOSED
member.summary: - Only Owner can add or remove users in a closed channels. Closed channels can't be found when searching for channels. Consequently, users can't subscribe on their own to closed channel.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.ConferencePhoneNumber.NeedLanguageSelection
member.summary:
- true means non-English bridges.
For English bridges: The mobile can dial : bridge number + accesscode #
For non-English bridges: The mobile can dial : bridge number + 1# + code #
The 1# may be replaced by 2# if the country of the called number is not the country of the user.
'+' is 'pause',

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability
member.summary:
To store all capabilitiesy for a user. For the moment, capabilities are known only for the current user.
To know if acCapability is available use, from object, the method **isCapabilityAvailable()**
In future release, others capabilities could be added.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.ReadReceipt
member.summary: - ReadReceipt: To know if the user can see Read Receipt (only set on company level)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.UseGif
member.summary: - UseGif: To know if the user can send GIF

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.FileStorage
member.summary:
- FileStorage: To know if the user can use the File Storage. File download is always possible event if this capability is set to FALSE
If it's set to FALSE, this capability is also set to FALSE: FileSharing

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.FileSharing
member.summary: - FileSharing: To know if the user in a Conversation can Upload, Save, Fwd or Share files. This capability can not be TRUE if FileStorage is set to FALSE

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.SoftPhoneOnly
member.summary:
- SoftPhoneOnly: To know if the user can ONLY use a SoftPhone.
If it's set to TRUE, this capabilities are all set to FALSE: WebRTCAudio, WebRTCVideo, WebRTCLocalSharing, Channel, InstantMessaging, Bubble, FileStorage and FileSharing

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.WebRTCVideo
member.summary: - WebRTCVideo: To know if the user can use Video in WebRTC (Peer to Peer context or in a conference)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.WebRTCAudio
member.summary: - WebRTCAudio: To know if the user can use Audio in WebRTC (Peer to Peer context or in a conference)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.WebRTCLocalSharing
member.summary: - WebRTCSharing: To know if the user can share its own screen

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.RecordingConversation
member.summary: - RecordingConversation: To know if the user can record a conversation.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.Channel
member.summary: - Channel: To know if the user can use channel (create or update channel, receive or publish items in channel)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.InstantMessaging
member.summary: - InstantMessaging: To know if the user can use IM (receive / send IM)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Contact.Capability.PhoneMeeting
member.summary: - PhoneMeeting: To know if the user can join a Phone Meeting (PSTN Conference)

member.summary: - Bubble: To know if the user can use bubbles

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Conversation
member.summary:
This class represents a conversation
A conversation is a "long" interaction(aka the "long tail") between the user and one or several contacts(Rainbow users or not) based on the IM media if the recipients are Rainbow users.
A conversation never ends and all interactions done can be retrieved.

For the moment there is 4 types of different files * Image: a image file - it's possible to know its original size * Voice Message or Conversation Recording: it's possible to know its specific ID and its duration * Other: any other file
According its type some object / properties are null

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Invitation
member.summary:
When an invitation is send to **a contact from the same company**, the invitation is **'auto-accepted'** - the contact is added in the roster without he needs to accept it.
When an invitation is send to **a contact not from the same company**, **he must accept it** first to have it in its roster.
It's not possible to know if the invitation is specifically declined by another contact - it's seen as 'pending' in this case.
store all possible status of an invitation
store all possible type of an invitation

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.Id
member.summary: - The invitation ID

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitedUserId
member.summary: - The contact ID of the invited contact

member.summary: - The phone number of the invited contact

member.summary: - The email of the invited contact

member.summary: - The contact ID of the inviting contact

member.summary: - he email of the inviting contact

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.RequestedNotificationLanguage
member.summary: - Requested notification language t(used to re-send email request in that language)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitingDate
member.summary: - Date the invitation was created

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.LastNotificationDate
member.summary: - Date when the last invitation was sent

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.AuthorizedReSendInvitationDate
member.summary: - Date when the inviting contact will be allowed to resend again the invitation to the invited contact. It'is only set if invitation still have the status pending.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.Status
member.summary: store all possible values of the invitation status (Pending, Accepted, AutoAccepted, Declined, Canceled or Failed).

member.name: P:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.Type
member.summary: store all possible values of the invitation type (Visibility or Registration )

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus
member.summary: Object to store all possible invitation status

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.Pending
member.summary: - Invitation has been sent by inviting contact and not yet accepted by invited contact

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.Accepted
member.summary: - Invitation has been accepted by invited contact

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.AutoAccepted
member.summary: - Invitation has been auto-accepted (case of contacts in same company)

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.Declined
member.summary: - Invitation has been declined by invited contact. Only invited contact can see that he has declined an invitation. Inviting contact still see the invitation as Pending

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.Canceled
member.summary: - Invitation has been canceled by inviting contact. If invited contact does not have an account in Rainbow, he can still use this invitationId received by email to create his Rainbow account, but he will not be added to inviting contact roster.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationStatus.Failed
member.summary: - Invitation email failed to be sent to invited contact (determined by parsing SMTP server logs). It can be the case if the provided invited email address does not exists.

member.summary: Object to store all possible invitation type

member.summary: - Invited contact exists in Rainbow

member.name: F:Rainbow.Model.Invitation.InvitationType.Registration
member.summary: - Invited contact did not exist in Rainbow when invitation was sent

member.name: T:Rainbow.Model.MediaPublication
member.summary:
Describe a Media publication in a Call (Audio, Video or Sharing) i.e. a media stream created by a peer
There is only one Audio Media Publication (in Conference on in P2P)
In P2P: - there is zero or one Video Media Publication - there is zero or one Sharing Media Publication
In Conferene: - there is zero or several Video Media Publication - there is zero or one Sharing Media Publication

member.name: T:Rainbow.Restrictions
member.summary:
To get / set restrictions usage of the SDK
According the way this SDK is used, for performance reasons, it's recommended to set some restrictions
For example in BOT context, it's better to set **MessageNotStored** to **true**, **ConversationsRetrievedFormat** to **"small"** and **SendReadReceipt** to **true**

member.name: T:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKEventMode
member.summary: List all events mode of the SDK.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKEventMode.XMPP
member.summary: XMPP mode - default mode. XMPP server is used to receive events and manage IM features

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKEventMode.S2S
member.summary: S2S mode. A callback URL must be set to receive events. IM features are done without XMPP. Few SDK events / methods are not available in this mode. See online documentation on the developer web site for the full details.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKEventMode.NONE
member.summary: No event mode used. The SDK is used only to perform REST call

member.name: T:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKMessageStorageMode
member.summary: List all storage modes of message .

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKMessageStorageMode.Unknown
member.summary: We don"t know the strogare mode used

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKMessageStorageMode.Store
member.summary: Default mode - When a message is sent, it will be stored by the server. So both, sender and receiver will retrieve it as archive even after reconnection.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKMessageStorageMode.NoPermanentStore
member.summary: The server will store the message, for the receiver ONLY, UNTIL he receives it. This message will not be available as archive.

member.name: F:Rainbow.Restrictions.SDKMessageStorageMode.NoStore
member.summary: The server will not store the message. If the receiver is not connected when the message is sent, he will never receive the message.

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.StreamManagement
member.summary:
True to use Stream Management: allow to reconnect more efficently to the server (BETA)
It's used only if **EventMode = SDKEventMode.XMPP**
Allow to resume up to 2/3 minutes after disconnection only if **MobileApplication = False** due to server limitations
Allow to resume up to 24 hours if **MobileApplication = true** (can be renew 21 days)
It's set to false by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.AutoReconnection
member.summary:
True to use service to try to reconnect auomatically to the server in case of network trouble
It's set to false by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.MobileApplication
member.summary:
True if ths SDK is used in a Mobile application context. It's important to set this correctly to have presence level correct is this context.
It's set to false by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.EventMode
member.summary: To get / set the event mode used by the SDK. Must be set before to Login and must not be changed after ...

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.AlertMessage
member.summary:
True to support Alert Message
It's set to **False** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.SendReadReceipt
member.summary:
True to send automatically a read receipt when a message (or an alert message) is received - can be useful in BOT context
It's set to **False** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.SendMessageToConnectedUser
member.summary:
True to allow to send message to oneself
It's set to **False** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.MessageStorageMode
member.summary:
To set the storage mode applied to all messages sent. By default **Store** mode is used.
If the SDK is used in BOT context it's highly recommended, for performance reasons, to use other modes: **NoPermanentStore** and **NoStore** (see **SDKMessageStorageMode** enum)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.MessageMaxLength
member.summary:
Maximum size of messages send by rainbow. Note that this value should not be modified without ALE Agreement
It's set to **16384** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.ConversationsRetrievedFormat
member.summary:
**"small"** to avoid to get **LastMessageText**, **LastMessageDate**, **UnreceivedMessageNumber**, **UnreadMessageNumber**, **LastAvatarUpdateDate** in when asking list of Conversations to the server.
**"full"** to have them
It's set to **full** by default - for BOT context it's better to use 'small' for performance reason

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.UseSameResourceId
member.summary:
True to use the same "resource id" in XMPP messages each time the SDK is used. The INI File is used to store it.
It's set to **True** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.UseWebRTC
member.summary:
Must be set to true if WebRTC is used.
It's set to **False** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.UseConferences
member.summary:
Must be set to true if you wan to use conferences
It's set to **True** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.UseAPIConferenceV2
member.summary:
This property is no more used. Whatever its value, API Conference V2 is now the only version supported on the server side
It's set to **True** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.UseMessageEditionAndDeletionV2
member.summary:
This property is no more used. Whatever its value, MessageEditionAndDeletion V2 is now the only version supported on the server side
It's set to **True** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.LogSdkResultOnError
member.summary:
To log all SdkResult if an error is raised
It's set to **True** by default

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.ChunkSizeUpload
member.summary: Size (in bytes) of the chunck used when a file is uploaded - Default value 1048576 (1024 * 1024 bytes => 1 Mb)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.ChunkSizeDownload
member.summary: Size (in bytes) of the chunck used when a file is downloaded - Default value 5242880 (1024 * 1024 * 5 bytes => 5 Mb)

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.MaxChunkSizeUpload
member.summary:
Maximum size (in bytes) of the chunck authorized by the server when a file is uploaded (read only)
Its valus is set once the initilization process is done

member.name: P:Rainbow.Restrictions.MaxChunkSizeDownload
member.summary:

Its valus is set once the initilization process is done

member.name: T:Rainbow.Telephony
member.summary:
This object is available only using from object.
This service manage PBX phone associated to the current user.
If you don't have this service activated for your Rainbow user, all these methods will return an error when called.
The main methods and events proposed in that service allow : * To know if this service is activated or not for the connected user, * To know the nomadic status and manage it * To know the call forward status and manage it * To handle telephony services: Make / Take / Release call, Hold / Retrieve a call, * To listen to call state update
An internal cache is used to store current PBX calls. It possible to acces to them using and . This cache is deleted automatically if current user is disconnected
End-user could use two devices in same time: the MAIN and the SECONDARY device.
When the SECONDARY is used (cf. ) you can only successfully handle telephony services on PBX calls using it.
According the agent version deployed, some services can return an error (unavailable service) when called

member.name: M:Rainbow.Telephony.ACDLogon(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String,System.Action{Rainbow.SdkResult{System.Boolean}})
member.summary: This api allows an ACD Agent to logon into the CCD system.
member.param: The endpoint device phone number.
ACD Agent identifier (agent device number) (optional)

Password or authorization code. (optional) The given password is transmitted as is to the Pbx, so there are two use cases : 1- the password is not requested by the Pbx : the password parameter has to be either empty or not present in the Logon. 2- the password is requested by the Pbx : the password parameter has be present in the logon. The password will be stored in in PCG for further requests (wrapup and logoff). In both cases, the password presence(sent in the ACD status) will be set at true.
ACD Agent's group number (optional)

Boolean (can be null) which indicates if the user wants to use the nomadic mode or not. 1- 'agentId' is present. 'nomadic' = true : the device corresponding to the agentId is tested to be suitable with nomadic mode, if not, the logon is rejected. 'nomadic' = false : the device corresponding to the agentId is tested to be suitable with legacy telephony, if not, the logon is rejected. 2- 'agentId' is not present or empty : 'nomadic' = true : a nomadic suitable device is selected from a pre-built pool(Pro ACD from REX type), and its will become the 'agentId' for the logon. 'nomadic' = false : the logon will be done on the Pbx without agentId. In this case we are assuming that the Pbx is configured to handle a logon without 'agentId'.

(optional) In order to address the nomadic mode with a Rex ProACD device, the PCG will activate a nomadic mode just before the Logon. If the destination is empty (or absent) or if the ProACD device is not a Rex, this nomadic login will not be done.
Callback fired when the operation is done - True is expected in **Data** member of if no error occurs

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.WriteToJsonFile``1(System.String,``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Writes the given object instance to a Json file.
Object type must have a parameterless constructor.
Only Public properties and variables will be written to the file. These can be any type though, even other classes.
If there are public properties/variables that you do not want written to the file, decorate them with the [JsonIgnore] attribute.
member.typeparam: The type of object being written to the file.
member.param: The file path to write the object instance to.
The object instance to write to the file.
If false the file will be overwritten if it already exists. If true the contents will be appended to the file.

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.ReadFromJsonFile``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Reads an object instance from an Json file.
Object type must have a parameterless constructor.
member.typeparam: - The type of object to read from the file.
member.param: The file path to read the object instance from.
member.returns: - Returns a new instance of the object read from the Json file.

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.GetJidNode(System.String)
member.summary:
Get the Jid node from the specified Jid
Examples:
- "cb9d411b7d42f2817@rainbow.com" will return "cb9d411b7d42f2817"
- "tel_cb9d411b7d42f2817@rainbow.com" will return "tel_cb9d411b7d42f2817"
- "cb9d411b7d42f2817" will return "cb9d411b7d42f2817"
member.param: Jid value
member.returns: - The Jid node value - empty string if not found

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.GetDomainFromJid(System.String)
member.summary:
Get the Domain of the specified Jid
For example if Jid is: 'fdsqsd1456546qsdf@mydomain.fr' the domain value is 'mydomain.fr'
member.param: Jid value
member.returns: - the domain value - empty string if not found

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.GetBasicNodeJid(System.String)
member.summary:
Return the Basic Node of a Jid (i.e. remove "tel_" if any)
Example:
"tel_cb9d411b7d42f2817@rainbow.com" will return "cb9d411b7d42f2817"
"cb9d411b7d42f2817@rainbow.com" will return "cb9d411b7d42f2817"
member.param: Jid (with node and domain)
member.returns: Returns the Node Jid

member.returns: - True if Jid provided is a Basic Node Jid

Get the Full Jid from the specified Jid with resource value

member.param: Jid with resource value

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.LogString(System.String)
member.summary:
To ensure privacy, return first letter and last letter of the string provided.
Other caracters are replaced by the char '-'
For example this string "bill" will be transformed into "b--l"
member.param: Name to log
member.returns: - String result

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.LogDotString(System.String)
member.summary:
To ensure privacy, split string using "." as separator and for each part use **LogString**
For example this string "bill.gates" will be transformed into "b--l.g---s"
member.param: Value to log
member.returns: - String result

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.LogEmail(System.String)
member.summary:
To ensure privacy, all email parts are serialized using **LogString** and **LogDotString**
For example this email "bill.gates@microsoft.com" will be transformed into "b--l.g---s@m-------t.c-m"
member.param: Email to log
member.returns: - String result

member.name: M:Rainbow.Util.LogPhoneNumber(System.String)
member.summary:
To ensure privacy, transform phone number with a lenght greater than 6 caracters using '-'
Examples: * "123" => "123" * "123456" => "123456" * "1234567890" => "123----890" * "+3312345678" => "+33-----678"
member.param: Phone number to log
member.returns: - String result
